q: Which type of review is considered a walkthrough?

Which Agile methodology matches this statement:

Uses industry best practices, such as regular builds, domain object modeling, and feature teams
Arises when a variable is not assigned with correct length or data type
What does the specification for a module typically define?
Ensures the highest level of software efficiency in the user input data
What type of test is a module test?
Identify the testing processes that make up the Installation test part of the development phase
c: External specification: It defines the exact representation of the program to users.
System design: It lays down the design principles of the system.
Requirement: It specifies the cause of the program.
Code: It produces the code for the required program.
a: Code: It produces the code for the required program.

q: Which software testing principle states that a programmer may subconsciously avoid finding errors for fear of retribution from peers, a supervisor, a client, or the owner of the program or system being developed?
c: Any testing process should include a thorough inspection of the results of each test.
Do not plan a testing effort under the tacit assumption that no errors will be found.
A programmer should avoid attempting to test his or her own program.
A programming organization should not test its own programs.
a: A programmer should avoid attempting to test his or her own program.

a: Verifies that the data is stored correctly and accurately.

Why is a code inspection more effective than a desk-checking process?
c: Because it is effective in finding high-level design errors
Because it finds difficult, obscure, and tricky errors
Because the author of the program is personally checking the code
Because people other than the author are involved in the process
a: Because people other than the author are involved in the process

q: Usability testing is a black-box testing techniques.
Acceptance testing is the process of comparing the program to its initial requirements and the current needs of its end users
When is a good time to start automation testing?
c: When you begin coding, so that the automation tests can be done ahead of time
At the end of the project, right before the user starts acceptance testing
When you are confident that you do not want anything to change in the code
When the scheduled milestone for automation testing is reached
a: When you are confident that you do not want anything to change in the code

q: How is quality defined in Extreme Programming?
c: Good communication between developers and testers
Meeting design specifications and customer expectations
a: Meeting design specifications and customer expectations

Supports multiple devices with a single unit
a: Skews performance on real device due to underlying hardware
Supports multiple devices with a single unit

q: Which statement matches the performance section of the business layer testing area.
c: Tests whether the application meets documented operational specifications
Tests to uncover errors in transaction processing, such as credit card processing, e-mailing verifications, and so on
Tests to detect errors in knowledge collected from customers
a: Tests whether the application meets documented operational specifications

c: Continuous testing of the code base
a: Continuous testing of the code base

q: Select the statements that match the Testing debugging method. (choose one)

It is effective in case of small applications.

a: It provides information useful in locating a suspected error.

q: Indicate if the given statement about exhaustive path testing is true or false.
c: It states that all the possible paths of control flow are tested through the program.

q: Indicate if the given statement about exhaustive path testing is true or false.
c: It does not guarantee that a program matches its specification.

q: Indicate if the given statement about exhaustive path testing is true or false.
c: It detects the absence of necessary paths within a program, if found missing.

q: Indicate if the given statement about exhaustive path testing is true or false.
c: It is inferior to exhaustive input testing.

c: It is a black-box testing technique.

q: Indicate if the given statement about usability testing is true or false.
c: It involves actual users or customers of the product.
